main event: Witnesses observed unusual flying objects in Silver Springs, Ohio on August 7 and August 11, 1947.
interesting points: The first sighting lasted for 2-4 seconds with a low-speed, bright orange glowing object similar in size to a B-29,The second sighting involved either 7 or 9 disc-shaped objects observed flying at high speeds between 25,000 and 30,000 feet,Objects flipped in perfect unison between black and bright approximately every 2 seconds,The observers included aviation professionals and a large number of spectators,The report suggests that the first event could have been misinterpreted as a meteor due to the short observation time.
sighted object: bright orange glowing object and disc-shaped objects
witness description: nine aircraft ground instructors, nine pilot and aircraft students, and approximately 25 spectators
